comment.description:
Creates an empty data chunk with the specified column types.
The result must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_data_chunk`.

param_comments.types: An array of column types. Column types can not contain ANY and INVALID types.

comment.description: Destroys the data chunk and de-allocates all memory allocated for that chunk.

Resets a data chunk, clearing the validity masks and setting the cardinality of the data chunk to 0.
After calling this method, you must call `duckdb_vector_get_validity` and `duckdb_vector_get_data` to obtain current
data and validity pointers
Retrieves the number of columns in a data chunk.

param_comments.chunk: The data chunk to get the data from

comment.return_value: The number of columns in the data chunk

comment.description:
Retrieves the vector at the specified column index in the data chunk.

The pointer to the vector is valid for as long as the chunk is alive.
It does NOT need to be destroyed.

param_comments.chunk: The data chunk to get the data from

comment.description: Retrieves the current number of tuples in a data chunk.

param_comments.chunk: The data chunk to get the data from

comment.return_value: The number of tuples in the data chunk

comment.description: Sets the current number of tuples in a data chunk.

param_comments.chunk: The data chunk to set the size in
param_comments.size: The number of tuples in the data chunk
